H0.text: A rockslide is an example of mechanical weathering.

H1.text: A volcano erupting is an example of mechanical weathering.

H2.text: An earthquake occurring is an example of mechanical weathering.

H3.text: A rock freezing and thawing is an example of mechanical weathering.

A4.text: frost weathering is a collective term for several mechanical weathering processes induced by stresses created by the freezing of water into ice.

A5.text: Ice growth is known to generate pressures of up to 207MPa, more than enough to fracture any rock.
